articles.title: About this site
articles.description: Some additional details about the website

articles.title: Data manipulation and visualization
articles.description: Resources to learn and improve data manipulation, exploration and visualization in R.
articles.contents:
Contents
Data Science
Data Manipulation
Data Visualization
Shiny


Data Science
Global resources to start data science including introductory and intermediate material on data manipulation, exploration, visualization and analysis.
Name
Links
STAT 545 J Bryan – A course about data wrangling, exploration, and analysis with R

R for Data Science H Wickham, G Grolemund Introduction to data science: import, transform, visualize and model data with literate programming and reproducible research
 
ModernDive C Ismay, A Y Kim – A textbook about statistical Inference via Data Science

Introduction to Data Science R A Irizarry – A textbook from R basics to an introduction to machine learning, through data manipulation and statistics in R

R Programming 101 – A youtube channel about data cleaning, manipulation & visualization

Exploratory Data Analysis J Helveston – A course to learn how to import, manipulate, clean, explore, visualize, and export data in R

Data Manipulation
Name
Links
Data Wrangling with R and the Tidyverse G. Grolemund An introductory playlist

Cleaning ecological survey data for conservation scientists C J Brown, C Buelow –

dplyr R Programming - DDS – an introductory playlist to dplyr and its functions

Data Visualization
Name
Links
Fundamentals of Data Visualization C . Wilke Theory on how to make right and nice figures, not R focused

R Graphics Cookbook W. Chang – A practical guide to help you generate high-quality graphs

R for Ecologists a youtube channel including basics on R and visualization

ggplot2 H. Wickham focus on explaining the grammar of graphics that ggplot2 uses, it is not a cookbook

Visualization – a R studio youtube playlist

Shiny
Name
Links
Shiny gallery – Find ideas about what is possible to do

A shiny workshop to start D Valle and others – A full course to start with shiny

Mastering Shiny Hadley Wickham – Designed to take you from knowing nothing about Shiny to being an expert developer

Engineering Production-Grade Shiny Apps C Fay, S Rochette, V Guyader, C Girard – learn the process of building an application that will later be sent to production

Shiny Developer Series – a youtube channel

articles.title: Ethical Statistics
articles.description: Resources for reproducible and ethical Statistics.
articles.contents:
Contents
Reproducibility
Tidyverse
Rmarkdown
Git

Ethics
Open science

Reproducibility
Name
Links
Reproducible science workshop O Gimenez – A full overview to start making your analyses reproducible

Tidyverse
Name
Links
Tidy Modeling with R M Kuhn, J Silge – Introduction to how to use Tidyverse

Rmarkdown
Name
Links
R Markdown: The Definitive Guide Y Xie, J J Allaire, G Grolemund – A complete and introducing reference book to use R Markdown

R Markdown Cookbook Y Xie, C Dervieux, E Riederer – A practical reference book for R Markdown

Tables generator – Create a markdown table

Git
Name
Links
Happy Git and GitHub for the useR – Learn how to start and integrate git into your daily work with R and Markdown

Github Docs – Official documentation

Ethics
Name
Links


Open science
Name
Links
SORTEE Society for Open, Reliable, and Transparent Ecology and Evolutionary biology

articles.title: Mathematics
articles.description: Resources on mathematical concepts useful for ecological statistics
articles.contents:
Contents
Calculus
Probability
Algebra
Teaching Mathematics in Ecology

Calculus
Name
Links
Learning Centennial College M Cheung – Definitions of useful words

Derivatives of Common Functions – Cheatsheet

Probability
Name
Links
Probability S Jadhav – Probability theory & description of main distributions, not really ecologist friendly…

Algebra
Name
Links
Learning Centennial College M Cheung – Definitions of useful words in Linear Algebra

Teaching Mathematics in Ecology
Name
Links
What math should ecologists teach? B McGill

Lack of quantitative training among early-career ecologists: a survey of the problem and potential solutions F Barraquand et al.

Writing mathematical ecology: A guide for authors and readers L G Shoemaker et al

Mathematical Ecology: A Century of Progress, and Challenges for the Next Century S Levin Lecture in 2017

articles.title: R
articles.description: Resources to start programming and statistics with R
articles.contents:
Contents
Programming in R
Data science in R
Packages
Others

Programming in R
Name
Links
First steps in R Institut Pasteur & USR 3756 – A very bascis tutorial to start R

Hands-On Programming with R G Grolemund – A practical guide to start programming with R

Introduction to Programming with R R Stauffer et al. – Basics R, writing, coding & manipulating data

Intro to Programming for Analytics J Helveston – Basics in R, include an introduction to Python

R introduction J Mathys VIB – A simple tutorial to start with R, only

How to R – A youtube channel incuding short videos on basics R, data manipulation and visualization

Advanced R H Wickham –

Efficient R programming C Gillespie R Lovelace – Increase the amount of work you can do with R in a given amount of time

Avoid for loops R programming DDS – Learn how to make your code faster

Data science in R
Name
Links
Statistics and Data Science with R M Marin – A complete course to start statistics with R. 5 series: getting started, descriptive statistics, probability distribution, bivariate analysis, linear regression with R

Introduction to data science R A Irizarry – A complete guide including R basics, data wrangling, data visualisation, statistics and machine learning

R Programming for Data Science R D Peng – Start with R, load and manipulate your data

Learning statistics with R D Navarro – A tutorial for beginners to start statistics and simple tests with R

Applied Quantitative Methods D McGlinn – A more advanced course introducing R programming, version control, SQL, GIS, spatial statistics, multivariate statistics

Packages
Name
Links
R Packages H Wickham, J Bryan

Others
Name
Links
R studio cheatsheets – Very useful synthetic sheets to find the function you need

Rstudio youtube channel

R Reference Card – Quick access & definition to simple R functions

R-Uni – A list of R tutorials and resources in university webpages

articles.title: Statistics
articles.description: Resources for a general introduction to descriptive and inferentials Statistics
articles.contents:
Contents
Overview
Distributions

Overview
Name
Links
Statistics 101 B Foltz – Complete videos for an introduction to statistics including descriptive statistics, Hypothesis testing, distributions, regression

MarinStatsLectures M Marin – A full course with 3 series: descriptive statistics, univariate analysis, bivariate analysis

Statistical Inference for biology McClatchy, Churchill – a course about inferential statistics

Statistics Simple Learning pro – Basics videos to start statistics

Zedstatistics Zedstatistics – a youtube channel including simple playlists about Descriptive statistics, Distribution, Inferential statistics, Regression

Learning Centennial College M Cheung – Definitions of useful words in statistics

Biology for life G von Bargen – Descriptions of simple statistical concepts and tests used in biology

Distributions
Name
Links
The distribution zoo B Lambert, F Cooper – A ShinyApp to visualize distributions

articles.title: Machine Learning
articles.contents:
Name
Links
Machine Learning for Ecology and Sustainable Natural Resource Management G Humphries, D R Magness, F Huettmann –

Data Science Live Book P Casas – Common issues in data analysis and machine learning

A translucent box: interpretable machine learning in ecology T C D Lucas

Applications for deep learning in ecology S Christin, E Hervet, N Lecomte –

Deep learning as a tool for ecology and evolution Borowiec et al.

Machine learning to classify animal species in camera trap images: Applications in ecology Tabac et al.

A practical guide to machine learning in ecology J Lefcheck – blog

Deep Learning for Ecology P Gray – brief overview of the applications of deep learning to ecology and remote sensing

In-depth introduction to machine learning T Hastie and R Tibshirani – 15 hours of expert videos, 2014

Machine Learning Mastery – A site including tutorials for machine learning from beginners to advanced levels

Awesome Machine Learning – A list of package for different software

Oxford Machine Learning N de Freitas, B Shillingford, M Moczulsky

Have a look also to [wikistat][https://github.com/wikistat] (Insa Toulouse, but in french)

articles.contents:

Links
Multivariate Analysis S Dray – Master course including PCA, Correspondance Analysis & two-table analysis

Gusta Me – a website describing range of analysis techniques used in microbial ecology

articles.title: Links
articles.contents:
Name
Links
Cross-Validated – The statistical forum

Ourcodingclub – Many different tutorial made by a group of student and researcher from the University of Edinburgh

Ecological Applications in R – a youtube channel creating for the Covid

Conservation hackers – forum, blog and courses for conservation scientists

R4DS – a community of R learners at all skill levels working together to improve their skills

Discdown – regrouping courses such as Data Analytic, programming in R and Flexible Regressions
